9.88.text: We're going to have a look at the 'turn in the road'

11.94.text: or as it used to be called a 'three point turn'.

15.22.text: This is peoples preferable manoeuvre to carry out on the driving test.

19.80.text: The object of this manoeuvre is turn the car around. Normally in three turns

24.20.text: using forward and reverse gears. Also remembering to observe for other road users

34.12.text: When starting this manoeuvre make sure that you start in a safe, convenient

37.84.text: and legal place. You certainly don't want to do this on a busy road

41.32.text: where there is other people about.

43.96.text: In this first part of the video I will be occasionally pausing it to highlight certain points of this manoeuvre .

51.40.text: First thing to consider will be the camber of the road.

55.12.text: It doesn't look much but it will affect us during this manoeuvre.

60.08.text: We first need to prepare the car.

62.44.text: So it will be clutch down, into first gear and then we get the gas and biting point.

67.88.text: It's important to get the biting point here as we'll be going over the camber up hill slightly.

72.88.text: Now we check all around, mirrors, blind spot.

75.80.text: We won't need to signal or other road users will think that we're driving off.

79.92.text: Then as soon as you release the handbrake

82.94.text: we will steer full lock, maximum to the right.

85.38.text: make sure that the car moves when you do this

88.22.text: or otherwise it's called dry steering and it wears out your tyres

90.32.text: As you steer round to the right, I can't emphasise enough how much that you have to look around...

99.26.text: looking out especially for pedestrians and cyclists.

100.70.text: Now as you get half way across the road

102.64.text: the camber of the road will go down hill slightly

104.66.text: so be prepared to lower the clutch down and brake a little.

109.98.text: it's good to steer a little to the left

111.12.text: as this helps for the reversing part.

115.64.text: we then put the handbrake on and put it into reverse gear

118.02.text: But how do we know when to stop

123.16.text: like it goes under the right-hand door mirror.

125.56.text: Before you reverse, make sure that you observe around.

129.36.text: Make sure that you check the back window as well

136.68.text: make sure that you wait, see what they're going to do

139.00.text: if they do leave you enough space to finish then

141.44.text: maybe it will be safe for you to carry on.

144.84.text: Because we are reversing up a camber

147.32.text: it's important to make sure that we get the gas and the biting point.

149.96.text: Also bear in mind that reverse gear is very powerful.

152.80.text: Be careful not to go too fast on this bit.

155.66.text: As soon as you move back, make sure that you steer

157.92.text: full lock to the left, steering quickly but driving slowly.

160.78.text: You're then going to go down hill the other side because of the camber

163.86.text: clutch down and brake a bit.

166.88.text: As you reverse, make sure that you're checking all around.

170.72.text: Check over your left shoulder and right shoulder.

172.30.text: Be prepared to steer a little to the right before you stop

176.14.text: as this can help for the final forward part.

178.54.text: We then put the handbrake on and then into first gear.

180.28.text: Now this is your reference point so that you know when to stop.

183.76.text: Over your right hand shoulder you'll see

185.88.text: that the kerb disappears into your right hand door pillar.

193.00.text: and then steer back round to the right

195.48.text: again, a bit of a hill start there because of the camber.

197.42.text: We will then stop on the left in a safe and convenient place.

201.66.text: That's how you do a turn in the road.

203.90.text: Now lets have a look at it again without all the pausing.

213.46.text: It's important when you do this manoeuvre to take your time.

220.06.text: Make sure that you observe left and right looking out for other road users

223.52.text: Get confident with your reference points.

230.10.text: When you reverse, again make sure that you're checking around.

231.82.text: Especially observe over your left shoulder.

236.22.text: Don't let other cars panic you

238.40.text: if they do arrive, they can see that you're learning.

247.67.text: That's how you do a turn in the road

250.06.text: I really hope it's been useful

252.80.text: if this video has then please give us a thumbs up 'like' at the bottom of the screen.

258.01.text: This helps us to make more videos.
